std_inline.citation:
'''Memorial''': Find a Grave (has image)
{{FindAGrave|87136641}} (accessed 6 May 2021)
Memorial page for William Shakespeare (23 Apr 1564-23 Apr 1616), citing Westminster Abbey, Westminster, City of Westminster, Greater London, England (plot: Holy Trinity Church, Stratford-upon-Avon, Warwickshire, England); Maintained by Find a Grave.
''"GOOD FRIEND FOR JESUS' SAKE FORBEAR,
TO DIG THE DUST ENCLOSED HERE,
BLESSED BE THE MAN THAT SPARES THESE STONES,
AND CURSED BE HE THAT MOVES MY BONES.

THE GRAVE
OF THE POET
WILLIAM
SHAKESPEARE
1564-1616"''.

std_narrative.citation:
William was mentioned on a memorial at Westminster Abbey, Westminster, City of Westminster, Greater London, England, with a death date of 23 April 1616. '''Memorial''': Find a Grave (has image)
